full_summary:
================

### Tender Announcement: TBIPS SA - Streams B2 - Level 1-3 and I4 Level 3

**Contract Title**: Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) for Streams B2 and I4

**Description**: The Courts Administration Service (CAS) is seeking to establish a contract with a qualified Indigenous supplier for the provision of Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) for Streams B2 and I4. The contract will support the CAS's digital transformation journey to improve access to justice and the quality of its services.

**Key Requirements**:

* Level 1-3 Business Consultants
* I4 Database Modeller/IM Modeller with Level 3 expertise
* Pre-qualified through the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) with a Tier 1 designation for services in the National Capital Region

**Contract Details**:

* Contract duration: Up to 3 years, with options to extend for two additional one-year periods
* Anticipated start date: April 15, 2024
* Estimated delivery date: N/A

**Trade Agreements**:

This contract is subject to the following trade agreements:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

**Contact Information**:

Marco Pelchat
Consultant, Procurement
Procurement.Approvisionnement@cas-satj.gc.ca
(613) 315-7390

**Note**: The TBIPS method of supply is refreshed three times per year. Interested suppliers can learn more about becoming a qualified SA Holder by contacting RCNMDAI-NCRIMOS@pwgsc.gc.ca. \\n

**Important Information**:

* Documents will be distributed electronically to pre-qualified suppliers.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on this procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language. \\n
